channel.title: Do live last Forever?
channel.description:
That's my question...
I don't mean by living as in breathing and things... In my religon we go to Heavan, and you living up there as your soul. But live just goes on and on? Does it ever end?

item.title: Do live last Forever?
item.dc:creator: @RLN RLN
item.description:
@RLN wrote:

Three arguments:

  • Logic (Strong)
    Our mind is our “soul”, and when we die so does our “soul”.

  • Ignorance (Weak, Stupid)
    God will always forgive my sins and when I die I’ll be judged and get to stay in heaven for all of eternity. This God has control over the entire universe and cares about anything good or bad I do.

  • Wishful thinking (Weak, Stupid)
    Reincarnation

All we know is what we can experience or have experienced. People making up theories to satisfy their mind makes for a weak argument - especially with no reason to believe it.

Read full topic

item.title: Do live last Forever?
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:

[quote=“pur3 pik3r 9, post:21, topic:104723”][quote author=KoRnRoOsTeR link=topic=149837.msg1422764#msg1422764 date=1180855654]
When Jesus Comes He Will Come and take all that Believe
[/quote]

That’s what I beilve.
When Jesus comes and wipes out the world, he will take all of the Christans.[/quote]

Only Christians? You obviously didn’t know that he was on earth to help everybody, the Jews thought he was only their for them, but he said no, then they got mad and so then they crucified him. As so what I heard. But obviously not only going to take the Christians. That’s crap.

item.title: Do live last Forever?
item.dc:creator: @nohope nohope
item.description:
@nohope wrote:

[quote=“pur3 pik3r 9, post:1, topic:104723”]That’s my question…

I don’t mean by living as in breathing and things…
In my religon we go to Heavan, and you living up there as your soul.
But live just goes on and on? Does it ever end?[/quote]
It doesnt end… Its like getting admin on mopar , then winning the lottery… going to the beach and staying in the mansion… marry the girl of your dreams… get a mansion… 1 million xbob’s with the best games… and more better stoof[quote=“BobDole81, post:12, topic:104723”]Well, I see two ways of looking at this personally.

First, following the scientific approach, consciousness is (according to the theory I like best, at least) is merely an emergent characteristic of our increased mental complexity…ie, through evolution, the capacity of our brains has increased to a stage at which consciousness and the ability to rationalize comes spontaneously (which is by no means saying that our mental complexity gives us the ultimate level of consciousness). So in this sense, consciousness and our sense of reality should have simply been realized some time after conception/birth. So when we die, that’s it…nothing after that.

A more spiritual approach would say that consciousness has been given to us for a reason. In regard to the Christian/Islamic dogmas, our consciousness would obviously be our tool to strive for a seat in heaven…it explains well what should happen when we die, but I don’t like it very much because it ignores what happens beforehand. Like Bebemycat2, I much prefer the idea of samsara, or reincarnation…it gives you more of a sense that one is on a long path to achieving something as opposed to being given a single lifetime in which to accomplish everything. It also explains what goes on before our current sense of consciousness.

That’s basically how I feel about it…

I will move this to the Debates forum since it seems better suited for this.[/quote]
We dont realy need to accomplish anything in this lifetime becuase all that matters is eternal happiness in fluffy cloudy happy heaven = ) … We dont need to do anything in life except being a good person and loving god… personaly to me god doesnt care what you do or how good you do it he just cares that what your doing is not doing something bad… god loves you bobdole… he thinks your special… you have a reason… everybodys special… everybody has a reason, he even loves the most evil person in the world = )

edit:[quote=“Bebemycat2, post:4, topic:104723”]Personally I don’t believe in heaven as it is depicted by the common religions (Christianity, Judaism, Islam). By that I mean, I don’t think that there is some “floating vacation city” in the sky.

I do however rather fancy the idea of reincarnation. But if not for that then I wouldn’t mind a place where I could meat dead relatives and such.[/quote]The place where you meet your dead relativves is heaven…

Read full topic

item.title: Do live last Forever?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Well, I see two ways of looking at this personally.

First, following the scientific approach, consciousness is (according to the theory I like best, at least) is merely an emergent characteristic of our increased mental complexity…ie, through evolution, the capacity of our brains has increased to a stage at which consciousness and the ability to rationalize comes spontaneously (which is by no means saying that our mental complexity gives us the ultimate level of consciousness). So in this sense, consciousness and our sense of reality should have simply been realized some time after conception/birth. So when we die, that’s it…nothing after that.

A more spiritual approach would say that consciousness has been given to us for a reason. In regard to the Christian/Islamic dogmas, our consciousness would obviously be our tool to strive for a seat in heaven…it explains well what should happen when we die, but I don’t like it very much because it ignores what happens beforehand. Like Bebemycat2, I much prefer the idea of samsara, or reincarnation…it gives you more of a sense that one is on a long path to achieving something as opposed to being given a single lifetime in which to accomplish everything. It also explains what goes on before our current sense of consciousness.

That’s basically how I feel about it…

I will move this to the Debates forum since it seems better suited for this.

Read full topic

item.title: Do live last Forever?

item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

hmm… its a wierd topic, idk were but there was a wierd explanation on sum tv show, it said that we are really the dead, and we are not living until we are in the after life or whatever, in my opinion, well… i guess i believe in reincarnation cause i really dont want to juse cease to be, the world cant get rid of me that easy ^^. heaven cant be perfect though if it does exist, then it would be more like hell, no challenges ever, no fun at all…(got that idea from twilight zone lol…)

item.title: Do live last Forever?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I’m afraid my view on it is that once you die… your brain stops functioning all that stuff… You are gone… It’s a pretty bleak look, but its what a believe.

The only way you can really go on living after death is to have done something that changes the earth with your life, that means no matter how long after your death - someone will be thinking of you.

meh my ramblings for ya.

oh by the way to the maker of this thread, you spelt life wrong, you kept spelling it “live” which is kinda annoying but im sure you can fix it

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

Personally I don’t believe in heaven as it is depicted by the common religions (Christianity, Judaism, Islam). By that I mean, I don’t think that there is some “floating vacation city” in the sky.

I do however rather fancy the idea of reincarnation. But if not for that then I wouldn’t mind a place where I could meet dead relatives and such, but not a place commonly thought of as “Heaven”.

Read full topic
